definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to have children/to raise or bring up/to educate
can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy

sentences.english: Radiotherapy and chemotherapy can damage the fertility and ovarian function heavily.
sentences.chinese: 放化疗严重损害患者的卵巢功能和生育能力。

sentences.english: What should I avoid to protect female fertility?
sentences.chinese: 我该避免些什么，以保护生育能力？

sentences.english: Consequently, women capable of bearing children tend not to accumulate excess fat on the belly.
sentences.chinese: 因此，女性的生育能力使得脂肪往往不会蓄积在腹部。

sentences.english: Not the least is their impact on our ability to reproduce.
sentences.chinese: 电波的作用不仅体现在对我们的生育能力影响上。

sentences.english: In addition, quantity and quality of eggs are just two factors affecting fertility.
sentences.chinese: 卵子的数量与质量只是影响生育能力的两个因素。

sentences.english: ‘I wouldn’t go rushing off to procreate on the basis that tomorrow my fertility might drop.’
sentences.chinese: 我将不会因我的生育能力明天可能衰退而急于生孩子。

sentences.english: Insects have an ability to breed rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫有着很强的生育能力。

sentences.english: The sperm count is used as an indicator of male fertility.
sentences.chinese: 男性生育能力可以用精子数来衡量。
有损害生育能力的危险。

sentences.english: During estrus, the female is fertile and will accept a male.
sentences.chinese: 在发情期，母犬可以接受交配并且具有生育能力。

sentences.english: Stress is no friend to fertility.
sentences.chinese: 压力是生育能力的大敌。

sentences.english: In particular, young men who use the drug recreationally could impair their ability to have families.
sentences.chinese: 使用抗阳痿的药物尤其年轻男性的生育能力有影响。

definition: to bear/to give birth/to grow/to rear/to bring up (children)/fertility
to be infertile/to have no offspring
